content.text: PHP MySQL Use The WHERE Clause
Select and Filter Data From a MySQL Database
The WHERE clause is used to filter records.
content.html: The WHERE clause is used to filter records.

content.text: The WHERE clause is used to extract only those records that fulfill a specified condition.
content.html: The WHERE clause is used to extract only those records that fulfill a specified condition.

content.code_html: SELECT column_name(s) FROM table_name WHERE column_name operator value

content.text: To learn more about SQL, please visit our SQL tutorial .
content.html: To learn more about SQL, please visit our SQL tutorial.

content.text: Select and Filter Data With MySQLi
The following example selects the id, firstname and lastname columns from the MyGuests table where the lastname is "Doe", and displays it on the page:
content.html: The following example selects the id, firstname and lastname columns from the MyGuests table where the lastname is "Doe", and displays it on the page:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
connect_error) {  die("Connection failed: " . $conn->connect_error); } $sql = "SELECT id, firstname, lastname FROM MyGuests WHERE lastname='Doe'";$result = $conn->query($sql);if ($result->num_rows > 0) {  // output data of each row  while($row = $result->fetch_assoc()) {    echo "id: " . $row["id"]. " - Name: " . $row["firstname"]. " " . $row["lastname"]. "
";   }} else {  echo "0 results";} $conn->close(); ?>

content.code_html:
<?php
$servername = "localhost";
$username = "username";
$password = "password";
$dbname = "myDB";

// Create connection
$conn = new mysqli($servername, $username, $password, $dbname);
// Check connection
if ($conn->connect_error) {
  die("Connection failed: " . $conn->connect_error);
}

$sql = "SELECT id, firstname, lastname FROM MyGuests WHERE lastname='Doe'";
$result = $conn->query($sql);

if ($result->num_rows > 0) {
  // output data of each row
  while($row = $result->fetch_assoc()) {
    echo "id: " . $row["id"]. " - Name: " . $row["firstname"]. " " . $row["lastname"]. "<br>";
  }
} else {
  echo "0 results";
}
$conn->close();
?>

" - Name: " . $row["firstname"]. " " . $row["lastname"]. "
";   }} else {  echo "0 results";} $conn->close(); ?>

"SELECT id, firstname, lastname FROM MyGuests WHERE 
  lastname='Doe'"

content.text: Code lines to explain from the example above:
content.html: Code lines to explain from the example above:

content.text: First, we set up the SQL query that selects the id, firstname and lastname columns from the MyGuests table where the lastname is "Doe". The next line of code runs the query and puts the resulting data into a variable called $result.
content.html: First, we set up the SQL query that selects the id, firstname and lastname columns from the MyGuests table where the lastname is "Doe". The next line of code runs the query and puts the resulting data into a variable called $result.

content.text: Then, the function num_rows() checks if there are more than zero rows returned.
content.html: Then, the function num_rows() checks if there are more than zero rows returned.

content.text: If there are more than zero rows returned, the function fetch_assoc() puts all the results into an associative array that we can loop through. The while() loop loops through the result set and outputs the data from the id, firstname and lastname columns.
content.html: If there are more than zero rows returned, the function fetch_assoc() puts all the results into an associative array that we can loop through. The while() loop loops through the result set and outputs the data from the id, firstname and lastname columns.

content.text: The following example shows the same as the example above, in the MySQLi procedural way:
content.html: The following example shows the same as the example above, in the MySQLi procedural way:

";   }} else {  echo "0 results";} mysqli_close($conn); ?>

content.code_html:
<?php
$servername = "localhost";
$username = "username";
$password = "password";
$dbname = "myDB";

// Create connection
 $conn = mysqli_connect($servername, $username, $password, $dbname);
// Check connection
 if (!$conn) {
  die("Connection failed: " . mysqli_connect_error());
}

$sql = "SELECT id, firstname, lastname FROM MyGuests WHERE lastname='Doe'";
$result = mysqli_query($conn, $sql);

if (mysqli_num_rows($result) > 0) {
  // output data of each row
   while($row = mysqli_fetch_assoc($result)) {
    echo "id: " . $row["id"]. " - Name: " . $row["firstname"]. " " . $row["lastname"]. "<br>";
  }
} else {
  echo "0 results";
}

mysqli_close($conn);
?>

content.code_html:
<?php
$servername = "localhost";
$username = "username";
$password = "password";
$dbname = "myDB";

// Create connection
$conn = new mysqli($servername, $username, $password, $dbname);
// Check connection
if ($conn->connect_error) {
  die("Connection failed: " . $conn->connect_error);
}

$sql = "SELECT id, firstname, lastname FROM MyGuests WHERE lastname='Doe'";
$result = $conn->query($sql);

if ($result->num_rows > 0) {
  echo "<table><tr><th>ID</th><th>Name</th></tr>";
  // output data of each row
  while($row = $result->fetch_assoc()) {
    echo "<tr><td>".$row["id"]."</td><td>".$row["firstname"]." ".$row["lastname"]."</td></tr>";
  }
  echo "</table>";
} else {
  echo "0 results";
}
$conn->close();
?>

content.text: Select Data With PDO (+ Prepared Statements)
The following example uses prepared statements.
It selects the id, firstname and lastname columns from the MyGuests table where the lastname is "Doe", and displays it in an HTML table:
content.html: It selects the id, firstname and lastname columns from the MyGuests table where the lastname is "Doe", and displays it in an HTML table:

syntaxHighlighting.text: "; echo "IdFirstnameLastname";class TableRows extends RecursiveIteratorIterator {   function __construct($it) {     parent::__construct($it, self::LEAVES_ONLY);   }   function current() {    return "" . parent::current(). "";   }  function beginChildren() {     echo "";   }   function endChildren() {     echo "" . "\n";   } } $servername = "localhost"; $username = "username";$password = "password";$dbname = "myDBPDO"; try {  $conn = new PDO("mysql:host=$servername;dbname=$dbname", $username, $password);   $conn->setAttribute(PDO::ATTR_ERRMODE, PDO::ERRMODE_EXCEPTION);  $stmt = $conn->prepare("SELECT id, firstname, lastname FROM MyGuests WHERE lastname='Doe'");   $stmt->execute();   // set the resulting array to associative  $result = $stmt->setFetchMode(PDO::FETCH_ASSOC);   foreach(new TableRows(new RecursiveArrayIterator($stmt->fetchAll())) as $k=>$v) {     echo $v;  }}catch(PDOException $e) {  echo "Error: " . $e->getMessage();}$conn = null;echo "";?>

"SELECT id, firstname, lastname FROM MyGuests 
  WHERE lastname='Doe'"
// set the resulting array to associative

// set the resulting array to associative

content.code_html:
<?php
echo "<table style='border: solid 1px black;'>";
echo "<tr><th>Id</th><th>Firstname</th><th>Lastname</th></tr>";

class TableRows extends RecursiveIteratorIterator {
  function __construct($it) {
    parent::__construct($it, self::LEAVES_ONLY);
  }

  function current() {
    return "<td style='width:150px;border:1px solid black;'>" . parent::current(). "</td>";
  }

  function beginChildren() {
    echo "<tr>";
  }

  function endChildren() {
    echo "</tr>" . "\n";
  }
}

$servername = "localhost";
$username = "username";
$password = "password";
$dbname = "myDBPDO";

try {
  $conn = new PDO("mysql:host=$servername;dbname=$dbname", $username, $password);
  $conn->setAttribute(PDO::ATTR_ERRMODE, PDO::ERRMODE_EXCEPTION);
  $stmt = $conn->prepare("SELECT id, firstname, lastname FROM MyGuests WHERE lastname='Doe'");
  $stmt->execute();

  // set the resulting array to associative
  $result = $stmt->setFetchMode(PDO::FETCH_ASSOC);
  foreach(new TableRows(new RecursiveArrayIterator($stmt->fetchAll())) as $k=>$v) {
    echo $v;
  }
}
catch(PDOException $e) {
  echo "Error: " . $e->getMessage();
}
$conn = null;
echo "</table>";
?>

"";   }  function beginChildren() {     echo "";   }   function endChildren() {     echo "" .
